If there is no winning ticket selecting the first three horses in exact order of finish, then any ticket within the applicable order of priority as previously stated is considered a winning ticket for distribution of the first race pool only, but does not entitle the holder of it to an exchange ticket.

After the official declaration of the first three horses to finish in the first race of the Double Triple, each bettor holding a winning ticket shall, before the running of the second designated race of the Double Triple, exchange at the designated Double Triple windows the winning ticket for both the monetary value from the first part of divided pool, as established by the mutuels department of the Association, and a Double Triple exchange ticket which designates the bettor's selection of the three horses for finish in that order in the second designated race of the Double Triple. Further money may not be required of the holder of the winning ticket in order to make the exchange. Until the second race of the Double Triple has been declared official, a person may not disclose the number of winning Double Triple tickets eligible for exchange in the second Double Triple race, nor shall any person disclose any information regarding those tickets during the exchange process.

A Double Triple exchange ticket for the second race of the Double Triple may not be issued except upon surrender of the Double Triple ticket from the first race as described in these rules. Windows, for the purpose of cashing and exchanging of winning Double Triple tickets, shall be open for the purpose of making exchange as described above only after the first race of the Double Triple has been declared official. The windows shall close when wagering closes for the second race of the Double Triple.

If a winning Double Triple ticket from the first race is not presented for cashing and exchange within the time provided above, the bettor may still collect the monetary value attached to the ticket but shall forfeit all rights to any distribution resulting from the second race of the Double Triple.

If a dead heat or heats occur in either the first race or second race of the Double Triple, all Double Triple tickets selecting the correct order of finish counting a horse in a dead heat as finishing in any position dead heated shall be winning tickets, and, contrary to the usual practice, the aggregate winning tickets shall be divided into the net pool and be paid the same pay-off price.

If there is no Double Triple ticket issued accurately selecting the officially declared first three finishers of the second race of the Double Triple, in the exact order, the second race pool, determined as provided in this rule, shall be held for the next consecutive racing day and combined with the pool of that program's second race of the Double Triple. Distribution of this special cumulative pool of the second race of the Double Triple shall be made only upon the accurate selection, in the exact order, of the first three officially declared finishers of the second race of the Double Triple.
Scratches.
If a horse is scratched in the first race of the Double Triple, all Double Triple tickets issued which include the scratched horse shall be refunded.
If a horse is scratched in the second race of the Double Triple, the stewards shall act as follows:

If there are more than 5 minutes to post remaining, as displayed on the infield tote board, the stewards shall declare, by means of a public address announcement, that tickets which include the scratched horse shall be exchanged before the running of the race; or

If there are 5 minutes or less to post remaining, as displayed on the infield tote board, the stewards shall determine if there are tickets issued which contain the scratched horse and act as follows:
If there are no tickets, the Second Half Double Triple betting is not affected; or

If there are tickets, the stewards shall declare, by means of a public address announcement, that the Second Half Double Triple wager for that day is cancelled, that the entire second part of the divided pool resulting from that current day's program only shall be distributed among all holders of Second Half Double Triple tickets, in accordance with established pari-mutuel practice, and that any carry-over of any Double Triple pool from any previous day's program may not be distributed on that racing day and shall be carried over to the next consecutive racing day.

If for any reason the field for either the first race or the second race of the Double Triple is reduced to less than seven interests before wagering is opened for the first race of the Double Triple, then Double Triple wagering may not be conducted on that day. If wagering has opened for the Double Triple and the field for either the first race or the second race of the Double Triple is reduced to less than seven interests before the first race of the Double Triple has been run, the stewards shall determine, in their sole and final discretion, whether Double Triple wagering will be refunded and not conducted on that day. If after the first race of the Double Triple has been run the field in the second race of the Double Triple is reduced to less than seven interests, the stewards shall determine, in their sole and final discretion, whether the race will be run as the second race of the Double Triple or, alternatively, whether Double Triple wagering will be cancelled, in which event the entire second part of the divided pool resulting from that current day's program only shall be distributed among all holders of Second Half Double Triple tickets, in accordance with established pari-mutuel practice, and any carry-over of any Double Triple pool from any previous day's program may not be distributed on that racing day and shall be carried over to the next consecutive racing day.

If for any reason the second race of the Double Triple is not declared official, the winning ticket holders who have cashed their ticket of the first race of the Double Triple and have received an exchange ticket, shall be entitled to be paid the remaining amount of the current program's divided pool.
Sales of Double Triple tickets other than from pari-mutuel machines shall be deemed illegal and prohibited.
The Double Triple pool shall be held entirely separate from all other pools, and may not be part of a daily double, exacta, triple, pick six, or other wagering pool.

If the accumulated carry-over pool of the Double Triple has not been distributed before the closing day of the meeting in which the pool was generated, the accumulated pool shall be carried over to the thoroughbred association next to operate that accepts Double Triple wagering. If the association next to operate does not accept Double Triple wagering, the accumulated pool shall be deposited in a Maryland bank in interest-bearing form and the accumulated pool together with all interest earned on it shall be carried over to the first day of the next racing meet of the thoroughbred association accepting Double Triple wagering.
Coupled entries are permitted but fields are prohibited in Double Triple races.

If the horses in a coupled entry finish in more than one of the first three positions, one or more of the horses, as necessary, finishing directly after the first three horses shall be used to complete a winning selection consisting of three different numbers.

The acceptance of a Double Triple ticket by taking an issued ticket away from the window of the terminal from which it was issued shall constitute an acknowledgment by the bettor of the correctness of the ticket. Each purchaser of a Double Triple ticket shall agree to be bound by the terms and provisions of this and all other applicable Commission rules and regulations and by the laws of the State pertaining to pari-mutuel wagering. The Association, totalisator company, and the State may not be liable to any person for a Double Triple ticket which is not:
A winning ticket in accordance with the provisions of this rule; or
Delivered for any reason, including but not limited to mechanical malfunction, electrical failure, machine locking, or other cause.
This rule shall be prominently displayed in the betting area of each Association conducting a Double Triple Program.

The Super Bet is a form of pari-mutuel wagering on three designated races. The bettor selects the two horses that will finish first and second in each of the first two designated races of the Super Bet, and the three horses that will finish first, second, and third in the third designated race of the Super Bet, in each case in the exact order of finish as officially posted.
The Super Bet pool shall be held entirely separate from all other pools, and may not be part of any exacta, triple, daily double, or other wagering pool. The Super Bet is not a parlay.
Repealed.
The three races which comprise the Super Bet shall be approved by the Commission and clearly designated in the program.
Super Bet tickets shall be clearly identified as such, so as to distinguish them from tickets on other wagering pools.
Coupled entries and fields are prohibited in the three designated Super Bet races.

If a dead heat or dead heats occur in any of the races of the Super Bet, all Super Bet tickets selecting the correct order of finish counting a horse in a dead heat as finishing in any position dead heated shall be winning tickets, and contrary to the usual practice, the aggregate winning tickets shall be divided into the net pool and be paid the same pay-off price.

Wagering for the Super Bet shall close at the same time that wagering is closed on the first designated race of the Super Bet. If a horse is scratched in a designated race of the Super Bet while wagering on the Super Bet is still open, wagers containing the scratched horse will be deducted from the Super Bet pool and will be refunded just as in other types of wagers. After the close of wagering on the Super Bet, if a horse has been scratched, a consolation pool, or pools, will be established in accordance with §P of this regulation.

If for any reason, including but not limited to, weather conditions, less than all of the designated races of the Super Bet are cancelled or are not declared "official," then all horses in the cancelled race or races that were selected on Super Bet tickets shall be considered winners for purposes of the Super Bet. If for any reason all of the designated races of the Super Bet are cancelled, then all pari-mutuel tickets that were issued for that performance shall be refunded and the Super Bet shall be cancelled for that performance. In all the above instances, any contributions to the Super Bet pool from prior performances will be carried over and included in the Super Bet pool for the next performance as prescribed in §J, below.

If there is no Super Bet ticket issued accurately selecting the officially declared winning combination in the exact order of finish in each of the three designated races of the Super Bet, then the net pool (the amount wagered less all applicable commissions and taxes under the laws of this State) shall be carried over and included with the net Super Bet pool at the next performance.

If the accumulated carry-over pool of the Super Bet has not been distributed before the closing day of the meeting in which the pool was generated, or if the Association invokes the provisions of §L, the net amount of the carry-over pool so remaining shall be distributed even if a Super Bet ticket is not a winning ticket under §A. In this event, the winning tickets shall be those combining on that performance the most consecutive finishers in the winning combination, starting with the winner of the first designated race of the Super Bet (for example, if the exact winning combination is 1-2, 1-2, 1-2-3, and the best ticket sold is 1-2, 1-2, 1-2-ALL). If there is a cancellation of the closing day's performance, the accumulated carry-over pool shall be carried over to the Thoroughbred Association next to operate that accepts Super Bet wagering. If the Thoroughbred Association next to operate does not accept Super Bet wagering, the accumulated carry-over pool shall be deposited in a Maryland bank, in interest bearing form, and the accumulated pool together with all interest earned on it shall be carried over to the first day of the next racing meeting of the Thoroughbred Association accepting Super Bet wagering.

The Association accepting Super Bet wagering may elect, if there is an undistributed accumulated carry-over pool of the Super Bet, to declare a mandatory Super Bet distribution, provided it makes an announcement of its intention to do so at least 24 hours before the opening of Super Bet wagering for that performance. In this event, all of the Super Bet carry-over pool shall be distributed on this performance, even if a Super Bet ticket is not a winning ticket under §A, in accordance with the provisions for determining a winning ticket under §K.

The Association may elect to guarantee a gross Super Bet (the accumulated carry-over pool plus gross Super Bet wagering on the current performance) by adding any shortfall from this guarantee to the accumulated carry-over pool, provided it makes announcement of its intention to do so before the opening of Super Bet wagering for that performance. Commissions or taxes may not be deducted from the added amount.

Sales of Super Bet tickets other than from pari-mutuel machines shall be deemed illegal and prohibited. Resale of Super Bet tickets from one individual to another is prohibited and shall be grounds for ejection.

The acceptance of the Super Bet ticket by an individual taking an issued ticket away from the windows of the terminal from which it was issued shall constitute an acknowledgement by the bettor of the correctness of the ticket. Each purchaser of a Super Bet ticket agrees to be bound by the terms and provisions of this and all other applicable Commission regulations and by the laws of the State pertaining to pari-mutuel wagering. The Association, totalisator, and the State may not be liable to any person for a Super Bet ticket which is not:
A winning ticket in accordance with the provisions of this regulation; or
Delivered for any reason, including but not limited to:
Mechanical malfunction,
Electrical failure,
Machine locking, or
Other cause.
Consolation Pools.
If one or more horses are scratched (scratches) after the close of wagering on the designated races of the Super Bet, consolation pools shall be established.

Consolation pools shall consist of the amount wagered on all combinations that contain the "scratches" after the deduction of all applicable commissions and taxes under the laws of this State from these wagers.

Wagers. The relationship that the above amount bears to todays net pool, before the deduction of the above amount from todays net pool, will be the relationship that it will bear to the pool carried forward to this performance (carry-over pool) for the purposes of distributing that portion of the "carry-over pool" to the holder of a winning wager as determined in §P(4), below.

A Super Bet wager which contains "scratches" shall participate in the consolation pool if the wager contains all other horses in the correct order of finish except the "scratches," or, if the "scratches" are in a superior position to the other horses selected, the other horses finish in the next most superior position vacated by the "scratches" or the next most superior position of any horse so advanced. For example, if the exact winning combination is 1-2, 1-2, 1-2-3, and the 4 horse was scratched in the third race of the Super Bet a wager of 1-2, 1-2, 1-2-4 would qualify as a winning consolation wager as well as a wager of 1-2, 1-2, 4-1-2 or 1-2, 1-4-2. No other combination would be a winning wager in this example. If there is no winning wager of the consolation pool, the amounts in the consolation pool shall be returned to the pools from which they were deducted before distribution from these pools. If §K or L of this regulation are invoked, the consolation provision of this section shall apply to §§K and L as well.
This regulation shall be prominently displayed in the betting area of each Association conducting a Super Bet program.

Except as provided in §B of this regulation, the Pick Three is a form of pari-mutuel wagering in which each bettor selects the winning horse in each of three consecutive races designated by the Association.
With the approval of the Commission, an Association may offer Pick Three wagering on three stake races scheduled to be contested over not more than 2 consecutive days.
The Association may designate a wager described in §A or B of this regulation with the name "Pick Three" or another name, subject to the approval of the Commission.
The Pick Three pool:
Shall be held entirely separate from all other pools;
May not be part of a daily double, exacta, trifecta, or other wagering pool; and
May not be a parlay.
The three races which constitute the Pick Three shall be clearly designated in the program or programs.
The Pick Three ticket shall be clearly distinguished from other pari-mutuel tickets with appropriate identification of the wager as a Pick Three wager printed on the ticket.
The Pick Three pari-mutuel pool shall be calculated as follows:

The entire net amount in the Pick Three pari-mutuel pool shall be distributed, in the usual manner, among those holders of tickets who correctly picked on the same ticket the winner of each of the three races comprising the Pick Three;
If no ticket is sold which:

Correctly contains the winner of each of the three races comprising the Pick Three, the entire net amount in the Pick Three pari-mutuel pool shall be distributed, in the usual manner, among those holders of tickets who correctly picked on the same ticket the winner of any two of the three races comprising the Pick Three;

Correctly contains at least the winner of two of the three races comprising the Pick Three, the entire net amount in the Pick Three pari-mutuel pool shall be distributed, in the usual manner, among those holders of tickets who correctly picked the winner of any one of the three races comprising the Pick Three; and
Would require the distribution of the Pick Three pool under this regulation, the Association shall make a full and complete refund of the Pick Three pool.
Entries and Scratches.

Those horses constituting an entry or a field, as defined within the regulations of the Commission, shall race in the races comprising the Pick Three as a single wagering interest for the purpose of the Pick Three pari-mutuel pool calculations and payouts to the public. A scratch, after wagering has begun, of any part of any entry or field selection in a race shall be of no effect with respect to the status of the entry or field, or both, as a viable wagering interest.

If a Pick Three ticket designates as a selection to win in any one or more of the contests comprising the Pick Three, a single wagering interest which is scratched, excused, or determined by the stewards to be a nonstarter in the race, the actual favorite, as evidenced by the amounts wagered in the win pool at the time of the start, will be substituted for the nonstarting selection for all purposes including pool calculations and payoffs, provided further that if the win pool for two or more favorites is identical, the selection shall be the lowest program number substituted for the nonstarting selection.
If, for any reason:

A race of a Pick Three program is cancelled or declared "No Race", the Pick Three pool shall be distributed among the holders of tickets containing the most winning selections in the remaining races in accordance with §H of this regulation;
Two or more races of the Pick Three are canceled or declared "No Race", all pari-mutuel tickets for that Pick Three pool shall be refunded;

A race of the Pick Three is cancelled or declared "No Race" and there is a dead heat for win in one of the remaining races, notwithstanding the provisions of §J of this regulation, all the horses in the dead heat for win shall be considered as the winning horse in that race for the purpose of distributing the Pick Three pari-mutuel pool; or

If one or more of the races comprising the Pick Three is a turf race and the race is switched from the turf to the main track after the close of wagering for the Pick Three, all selections in that race on a Pick Three pari-mutuel ticket shall be considered a winning selection.
If there is a dead-heat for win between two or more horses in any Pick Three race, the calculation for the purpose of distributing the net Pick Three pool is as follows:
The net Pick Three pool, less the amount bet on the winning combinations, shall be divided by the number of winning combinations;
Divide the quotient of §J(1) of this regulation by the amount bet on each winning combination;

The $1 payoff price for a winning combination is $1 added to the quotient from §J(2) of this regulation for that winning combination, rounded to the next lowest integer in conformance with the breakage provision currently in effect.

A person may not disclose the number of tickets sold in the Pick Three pool or the amount of tickets selecting winners of Pick Three races before the time the stewards have declared the last Pick Three race on any given date "official".
A pari-mutuel ticket for the Pick Three pool may not be sold, exchanged, or cancelled after the close of wagering in the first of the three races comprising the Pick Three.
Pick Three Tickets.
A validly issued Pick Three ticket timely surrendered to the Association by the legal holder of it shall be the only evidence of a person's participation in the Pick Three pari-mutuel pool.

The acceptance of a Pick Three ticket by taking an issued ticket away from the window or terminal at which it is purchased shall constitute an acknowledgment by the purchaser of the correctness of the ticket.

Each purchaser of a Pick Three ticket agrees to be bound by the terms and provisions of this and all other applicable Commission rules and regulations and by the laws of the State pertaining to pari-mutuel wagering.
The Association, totalisator company, and the State may not be liable to a person for a:
Ticket which is not a winning ticket in accordance with the provisions of this regulation; or
Pick Three ticket not delivered for any reason, including but not limited to mechanical malfunction, electrical failure, machine locking, or other cause.
This regulation shall be prominently displayed through the betting area of each Association conducting a Pick Three wager.

The Commission shall establish a system of intertrack wagering. This system is limited to betting at the racetrack of an association which is not itself conducting the race on which betting is being taken (the "receiving track") on a race which is being conducted live or by simulcast on a licensed racing day at the racetrack of another association (the "sending track"). All betting under this regulation shall take place within the confines of the racetrack of the receiving track.
The Commission may permit:
An association desiring to conduct intertrack wagering under this regulation to do so provided that the request is approved by each:
Sending track;
Receiving track;
Group representing a majority of the horsemen:
Then racing at the sending track,
Who raced at the receiving track at its last meeting;
Wagering under this regulation only between associations licensed under Business Regulation Article, Title 11, Subtitle 5, Part II, Annotated Code of Maryland.

Money wagered at the receiving track on races on which intertrack wagering is permitted shall be included in the applicable mutuel pools at the sending track, and shall for all purposes be considered as if wagered at the sending track. Without limiting the generality of the above, computation of the takeout, breakage, and State tax on all wagering at the receiving track shall be the same as that normally applicable to racing conducted at the sending track. All pari-mutuel information regarding the money wagered at the receiving track shall be transmitted by telephone wire directly to the sending track and incorporated with the information on wagering at the sending track.

Each race on which intertrack wagering is permitted shall be simulcast live from the sending track to the receiving track via telephone wire, television signal, satellite signal, or other means approved by the Commission.
The Commission shall have jurisdiction over all wagering and other activities at the receiving track to the same extent as it has when live racing is being conducted at that facility.
Nothing contained in this regulation shall constitute the employees of the receiving track as employees of the sending track.

The quad is a contract by the purchaser of a ticket combining four horses to finish first, second, third, and fourth in that specific order in a race on which quad wagering is offered. Payment of the ticket shall be made only to the purchaser who has selected the same order of finish as officially posted.
The quad is not a parlay and has no connection with, or relation to, any other wagering pool and shall be calculated as an entirely separate pool.
Repealed.

If a ticket was not sold on the winning combination of a quad pool, the net pool shall be distributed to the holders of tickets selecting the first, second, and third finishers in that specific order. However, if a ticket was not sold combining the first, second, and third finishers in that specific order, the net pool shall be distributed to the holders of tickets selecting the first and second finishers in that specific order. However, if a ticket was not sold containing any of the above combinations, the net pool shall be distributed to the holders of tickets selecting the correct first place finisher. If less than four horses finish, the payoff shall be made to holders of tickets selecting the finishing horses in order, ignoring the balance of the selection.
If a ticket was not sold that would require distribution of the net quad pool to a winner as defined in §D of this regulation, the association shall make a full refund of the quad pool.

In the event of a dead heat or dead heats, all quad tickets selecting the correct order of finish, counting a horse in a dead heat as finishing in all of the positions encompassed by the dead heat, shall be winning tickets. When a dead heat occurs, the payoff shall be calculated using the same logic used for calculating the place and show pools.

In the event of a scratch in the quad, exchanges are not made. All tickets which include the scratched horse are eliminated from further participation in the quad pool and shall be refunded. Refunds on key horse wheel tickets may be made after the quad race is official. Key horse wheel tickets shall be sold during the entire quad wagering period at the posted price used when quad wagering opens.
Coupled entries are permitted but fields are prohibited in quad races.
If the horses in a coupled entry finish in more than one of the first four positions, one or more of the horses, as necessary, finishing directly after the first four horses shall be:
Used to complete a winning selection consisting of four different numbers; and
Assigned the positions behind those horses which have been advanced due to the coupled entry finishing in more than one of the first four positions.

Quad tickets shall be sold only by the licensee through pari-mutuel machines programmed to print all selections on one ticket. Resale of the tickets from one individual to another is prohibited and shall be grounds for ejection.
This regulation shall be printed in heavy type in a conspicuous place in the program, or prominently posted near the betting windows of any association permitted to conduct this type of wager.
The Pick-7 pari-mutuel pool is not a parlay and has no connection with or relation to any other pari-mutuel pool.

The Pick-7 pari-mutuel pool consists of amounts wagered by individuals on the individuals' selections to finish first in each of the 7 races designated by an Association, with the approval of the Commission, to be part of the Pick-7 wager.

Horses constituting an entry of coupled horses or horses coupled to constitute the mutuel field in a race comprising the Pick-7 shall race as a single wagering interest for the purpose of the Pick-7 pari-mutuel pool calculations and payout to the public. However, if part of an entry or field is scratched and any part of either an entry or field racing as a single wagering interest is a starter in a race, the entry or field, if selected, shall remain as the designated selection to win in that race for the Pick-7 wager and the selection may not be deemed a scratch.

If a Pick-7 pari-mutuel ticket contains a single wagering interest or an entire "entry of coupled horses" or "mutuel field" which is scratched, excused, or determined by the host track stewards to be a nonstarter in the race, after wagering on the Pick-7 has commenced, the actual favorite, as evidenced by the amounts wagered in the host track win pool at the time of the start of the race, will be substituted for the nonstarting selection for all purposes, including pool calculations and payoffs. In the unlikely event that the win pool for two or more favorites is identical, the selection shall be the lowest program number of the cofavorites substituted for the nonstarting selection.
Pick-7 Pari-Mutuel Pool.
The Pick-7 pari-mutuel pool shall be calculated as follows:
The net pool, that is, the total amount wagered less the applicable takeout, shall be allocated 75 percent to a major share and 25 percent to a minor share;
The major share shall be distributed among holders of Pick-7 tickets which contain the correct selections of the winner of each of the 7 races comprising the Pick-7;
The minor share shall be distributed among holders of Pick-7 tickets which contain the most correct selections of the winner of each of the 7 races comprising the Pick-7 but fewer than 7.

If there is no pari-mutuel ticket issued which correctly selects the winners of each of the 7 races comprising the Pick-7, then the entire net pool shall be distributed among holders of Pick-7 tickets which contain the most correct selections of the winner of each of the 7 races comprising the Pick-7.

If there is a dead heat for win between two or more horses in any Pick-7 race, all the horses in the dead heat for win shall be considered as the winning horse in the race for the purpose of calculating the Pick-7 pari-mutuel pool.

If, for any reason, any race or races of a Pick-7 is cancelled and declared "no race", the Pick-7 pool shall be distributed to the holders of the most winning selections of the remaining races pursuant to §E, except that if, for any reason, three or more races of a Pick-7 are cancelled and declared "no race", all pari-mutuel tickets for that Pick-7 pool shall be refunded and the Pick-7 cancelled for that day.

A pari-mutuel ticket for the Pick-7 pool may not be sold, exchanged, or cancelled after the time of the closing of wagering on the first of the seven races comprising the Pick-7 except for refunds on Pick-7 tickets that are required by this regulation.
The Pick-7 with Carry-Over pari-mutuel pool is not a parlay and has no connection with or relation to any other pari-mutuel pool.

The Pick-7 with Carry-Over pari-mutuel pool consists of amounts wagered by individuals on the individuals' selections to finish first in each of the seven races designated by an Association, with the approval of the Commission, to be part of the Pick-7 with Carry-Over wager.

Those horses constituting an entry of coupled horses or those horses coupled to constitute the mutuel field in a race comprising the Pick-7 with Carry-Over shall race as a single wagering interest for the purpose of the Pick-7 with Carry-Over pari-mutuel pool calculations and payout to the public. However, if part of an entry or field is scratched and any part of either an entry or field racing as a single wagering interest is a starter in a race, the entry or field, if selected, shall remain as the designated selection to win in that race for the Pick-7 with Carry-Over wager and the selection is not considered a scratch.

If a Pick-7 with Carry-Over pari-mutuel ticket contains a single wagering interest or an entire "entry of coupled horses" or "mutuel field" which is scratched, excused, or determined by the stewards to be a nonstarter in the race, after wagering on the Pick-7 with Carry-Over has begun, the actual favorite, as evidenced by the amounts wagered in the win pool at the time of the start of the race, will be substituted for the nonstarting selection for all purposes, including pool calculations and payoffs. In the unlikely event that the win pool for two or more favorites is identical, the selection is the lowest program number of the cofavorites substituted for the nonstarting selection.
The Pick-7 with Carry-Over pari-mutuel pool shall be calculated as follows:
The net pool, which consists of the total amount wagered less the applicable takeout, shall be allocated:
75 percent to the carry-over share, and
25 percent to a best-of-seven share;

The carry-over share shall be distributed among holders of Pick-7 with Carry-Over tickets which contain the correct selections of the winner of each of the seven races comprising the Pick-7 with Carry-Over;

The best-of-seven share shall be distributed among holders of Pick-7 with Carry-Over tickets which contain the most correct selections of the winner of each of the seven races comprising the Pick-7 with Carry-Over but fewer than seven;

If there is no pari-mutuel ticket issued which correctly selects the winners of each of the seven races comprising the Pick-7 with Carry-Over, then the carry-over share from this day shall be added to the carry-over share of the next program to offer this type of wager at a track licensed under Business Regulation Article, §11-302, Annotated Code of Maryland;

If a succeeding track does not offer this type of wager or if a track wishes to discontinue this type of wager or create a mandatory distribution of the carry-over share, upon the approval of the Commission, the carry-over share on the program so designated shall be distributed among holders of Pick-7 with Carry-Over tickets which contain the most correct selections of the winner of each of the seven races comprising the Pick-7 with Carry-Over on that program.

If there is a dead heat for win between two or more horses in any Pick-7 with Carry-Over race, all the horses in the dead heat for win are considered as the winning horse in the race for the purpose of calculating the Pick-7 with Carry-Over pari-mutuel pool.

If, for any reason, any race or races of a Pick-7 with Carry-Over is cancelled and declared "No Race", the entire Pick-7 with Carry-Over net pool, exclusive of amounts added from prior programs, shall be distributed to the holders of the most winning selections of the remaining races pursuant to §E(3) of this regulation. If, for any reason, three or more races of a Pick-7 with Carry-Over are cancelled and declared "No Race", all pari-mutuel tickets for that Pick-7 with Carry-Over pool shall be refunded and the Pick-7 with Carry-Over cancelled for that day.

A pari-mutuel ticket for the Pick-7 with Carry-Over pool may not be sold, exchanged, or cancelled after the time of the closing of wagering on the first of the seven races comprising the Pick-7 with Carry-Over, except for those refunds on Pick-7 with Carry-Over tickets required by this regulation.
Repealed.
Races upon which the Pick-7 with Carry-Over are conducted shall be approved by the Maryland Racing Commission and clearly designated in the program.
This rule shall be prominently displayed throughout the betting area of the association conducting this type of wager.
Commingling of pari-mutuel pools occurs when all wagers which are made, both within and outside of Maryland on a specific pari-mutuel pool, are combined for the purpose of determining a payout.
For the purpose of this regulation:
"Gross pool" means the total monies accumulated in a specific wagering pool before the deduction of the applicable takeout as prescribed by the law in the jurisdiction in which the wagers take place.
"Net pool" means the total monies accumulated in a specific wagering pool after the deduction of the applicable takeout as prescribed by the law in the jurisdiction in which the wagers take place.

When an association in Maryland is permitted to commingle the wagers made in Maryland on a race in another jurisdiction with the wagers made at the association in the other jurisdiction, and the public is notified that commingling is taking place, the winning wagers shall be paid at the price determined by the odds posted at the association where the live race took place except, once wagering has begun and circumstances prevent the commingling from being accomplished, there shall be a refund of all these wagers made at the Maryland association, if:
A public announcement is made by the Maryland association not less than 2 minutes before the post time of the race that commingling cannot be accomplished, when the wager involves only one race; or
The wager involves more than one race, and a public announcement is made by the Maryland association that commingling cannot be accomplished:
By the off time of the first race of the wager, or
Not more than 10 minutes after the finish of the first race of the wager, unless there is a payoff due on a wager as a result of the first race.

If a payoff is due under the exception to §C(2)(b) of this regulation, there is no refund and the payoff shall be multiplied by a number which would make the sum of the payoff of all winning wagers on the first race of the pool equal to the net pool on that wager, exclusive of any carryover.

An association in Maryland shall request and receive permission from the Commission before entering into a commingling agreement with an entity, or entities, in other jurisdictions. The request shall include the method of commingling to be used, that is, the net pool method or the gross pool method.
If the net pool method is employed, the Maryland association shall apply the base payout price to the winning wagers in the Maryland association's pool to determine the payout on these wagers.
If the gross pool method of commingling is used, the takeout on wagers placed in Maryland is the same as the takeout used at the association at which the live race takes place.
Underpayment or Overpayment.
When a payoff is required under §C or D of this regulation, a resulting underpayment or overpayment of the distributable pools shall be accumulated to determine a net overpayment or underpayment.

Within 10 days after the end of the calendar year, the association shall report a net underpayment for the year to the Commission, and the association shall add the net underpayment to future distributable pools as directed by the Commission.
If there is a net overpayment at the end of the calendar year, it may be carried forward to the succeeding calendar year and shall become a part of the accumulation for that calendar year.
When wagers on a race or races are commingled, the regulations in the jurisdiction where the race or races take place shall be used in administering the wager.
The Bingo Bet is a type of bet in which betting interests are selected and placed in a total of nine blocks, arranged in three columns with three blocks in each column thereby forming a square.
For the columns described under §A of this regulation, the totalisator company shall assign to each block in column:
One, the number of a betting interest selected to finish first;

Two, the number of a betting interest selected to finish first or second, except that the center block of this column shall be assigned the number of the betting interest that actually finishes first in the race; and
Three, the number of a betting interest selected to finish first, second, or third.
Repealed.
A bettor wishing to participate in this type of bet may:

Select a single betting interest to be placed randomly by the totalisator computer in any one block in the bet, except the center block in column two, and allow the totalisator computer to randomly assign the numbers of the betting interests to the other seven blocks in the bet; or
Allow the totalisator computer to randomly assign the numbers of the betting interests to all of the blocks, except the center block in column two.

A winning combination consists of three contiguous blocks forming a straight line, either diagonally, vertically, or horizontally, containing the betting interests which finished in the position selected, or higher, in accordance with the official order of finish.
A single bet may contain as many as eight winning combinations.

The totalisator company shall divide the net pool on this type of bet by the total number of winning combinations with the resulting quotient, rounded down to the nearest whole multiple of 10 cents, being the payoff on each winning combination.
The payoff on a winning combination, as calculated under §G of this regulation, may not be less than 10 cents.

If there is a dead heat for first, second, or third place in a race on which a Bingo Bet is offered, the totalisator company shall consider the numbers assigned to the betting interests involved in the dead heat as finishing in the position for which there was a dead heat.

If more than one horse in an entry or field finishes in one or more of the first three positions in the race, the totalisator company shall use one or more of the horses, as necessary, finishing directly after the first three horses until there are three different betting interests to represent the first three positions at the finish of the race for the purposes of this bet.
If a betting interest is scratched, excused, or determined by the stewards to be nonstarter, the totalisator company shall substitute the:
Actual favorite, as evidenced by the amounts bet in the win pool when betting on the race is closed, for that betting interest; or
Favorite with the lowest program number for that betting interest if the amount bet in the win pool is identical on two or more favorites when betting on the race is closed.
If fewer than three betting interests in a race offering the Bingo Bet finish the race, the stewards shall order a refund of the entire pool for that bet in that race.

If, after considering the other provisions of this regulation, there is no winning selection on the Bingo Bet, the racing association shall carry forward the entire net pool from the Bingo Bet and add it to the net pool of the Bingo Bet on the next race for which it is offered.
Definition.
In this regulation, the following term has the meaning indicated.

Term Defined. Head-to-head wager means a bet in which an individual selects one of two designated horses in a particular race to reach the finish line before the other, regardless of the position in which the other horses finish the race.
The association shall designate:
Which races a head-to-head wager will be offered; and
Which horses in each race are the selections for the head-to-head wager.
Races in which a head-to-head wager is offered shall be:
Approved by the Commission; and
Clearly designated in the program.
Horses coupled as a betting entry or horses coupled to constitute a mutual field may not constitute one of the selections in a head-to-head wager.
A head-to-head wager is not a parlay and has no connection with, or relation to, any other pari-mutuel pool.
A head-to-head wagering pari-mutuel pool shall be considered a regular pari-mutuel pool for the purposes of takeout and the allocation of takeout.
Repealed.
The entire head-to-head wagering pool shall be refunded if:
One of the designated horses is scratched or declared a nonstarter by the stewards;
A dead heat occurs between the two horses designated for the head-to-head wager; or
Both designated horses fail to finish the race.
The rules pertaining to a head-to-head wager shall be:
Prominently displayed in the wagering area; and
Made available to anyone requesting a copy.

The Pick (n) is a type of bet encompassing four or more races, the exact number of races being determined by the number substituted for (n). In Pick (n), a bettor selects a betting interest to finish not lower than the position specified for this bet by the racing association for each of the races comprising the bet.
A Pick (n) bet shall be refunded if:
For any reason, 50 percent or more of the races scheduled as a part of this bet are cancelled or declared a "no contest"; or
No bet qualifies for a payoff under the provisions of §D, E, or F(1) of this regulation, and the provisions of §H of this regulation have not been invoked.

If one or more of the races scheduled as part of the Pick (n) bet, but fewer than the number specified under §B(1) of this regulation, are cancelled or declared a "no contest", the net pool on the Pick (n) bet from that day only shall be distributed, on a pari-mutuel basis, among the bets which contain the most correct selections for the races which were run.

Except as provided in §C or D of this regulation, the net pool created under a Pick (n) bet, along with any carryover from previous pools of the same type of bet, shall be distributed on a pari-mutuel basis among bets which contain:
All the correct selections; or
The most correct selections, if:
No bet contains all the correct selections; and
The racing association has given prior notice that there will be a mandatory distribution of the carryover.

If no bet contains all the correct selections in accordance with §D(1) of this regulation, and §D(2) of this regulation has not been invoked, the net pool created under a Pick (n) bet shall be divided into two pools, where:
One pool shall be distributed among those bets which contain the most correct selections; and
The other pool shall be carried over to the next program to offer this type of bet.
The formula for allocating the net pool among the two pools created under §E of this regulation shall be:
Established by the racing association; and
Maintained as established, until:
A bet contains all the correct selections; or
The carryover pool is distributed in accordance with the provisions of §D(2) of this regulation.
Assignment of Entire Net Pool.
Upon giving prior notice, a racing association may conduct a Pick (n) for which the entire net pool created by this bet may only be distributed to bets which contain all the correct selections.

If the racing association elects to employ the provisions of §G(1) of this regulation, the association shall continue to employ these provisions until the pool created by employing these provisions, including the carryover pool, if any, has been distributed.

If a dead heat or heats occur involving horses finishing in, or higher than, any of the places for which this bet is offered, a horse in a dead heat shall be considered as finishing in the position for which it dead heated.

If there is more than one combination of winning bets, the aggregate dollars bet on the winning combinations shall be used to calculate the will pay without regard to the amount bet on one winning combination in relation to the amount bet on another winning combination.
If a betting interest is scratched, excused, or determined by the judges to be a nonstarter:

The actual favorite, as evidenced by the amounts bet in the win pool when betting on the race in which the scratched betting interest was to participate is closed, shall be substituted for that betting interest;

If the amount bet in the win pool is identical on two or more favorites when betting on the race is closed, the favorite with the lowest program number shall be substituted for the scratched betting interest; or

Alternatively, the association may allow patrons the option of selecting an alternate wagering interest to be substituted for the scratched, excused or nonstarter wagering interest instead of the actual favorite as defined above, however, should that alternate selection also be scratched, the patron would then receive the actual favorite as defined above.

If one or more of the races comprising the Pick (n) is a turf race and the race is switched from the turf to the main track after the close of wagering for the Pick (n), each selection in that race on a Pick (n) pari-mutuel ticket shall be considered a winning selection.
In this regulation, the following terms have the meanings indicated:
"Racing association" means the racing association in the State conducting Quad Trifecta wagering.
"Net Quad Trifecta pool" means the total amount wagered in the Quad Trifecta pool, except for any carryover generated from previous Quad Trifecta wagering, less the appropriate take-out.

"Single price pool" means the method of determining a pay-off price where the aggregate winning tickets are divided into all, or a designated percentage, of the Net Quad Trifecta pool with each winning ticket having the same pay-off price per unit wager.
The Quad Trifecta is a type of bet in which a bettor selects three different betting interests to finish first, second, and third, in exact order, in each of four designated races.
The four races which comprise the Quad Trifecta:
Shall be designated by the racing association;
Shall be clearly designated in the program; and
May originate from one or more race tracks.
The Quad Trifecta pool shall be held entirely separate from all other pools.
Subject to Commission approval, the racing association shall establish the minimum amount for a bet on the Quad Trifecta.
Quad Trifecta tickets shall be clearly identified to distinguish them from tickets for other types of wagers.
Designation and Distribution of Shares—General.

Subject to Commission approval, the racing association shall designate a major share of the net Quad Trifecta pool, as described in §H of this regulation, and, in addition, may designate one or more of the following:
A principal minor share of the net Quad Trifecta pool, as described in §I of this regulation; and
One or more additional minor shares of the net Quad Trifecta pool as described in §J of this regulation.
Subject to Commission approval, the racing association shall determine the distribution of the net Quad Trifecta pool by designating:
The minimum number of correct selections, or range of selections, of the first three finishers, in exact position, in the Quad Trifecta races which results in a winning bet; and
The percentage of the net Quad Trifecta pool for distribution of each of the shares designated by the racing association under §G(1) of this regulation.
The racing association shall publish in the program for live racing on which Quad Trifecta wagering is conducted:
Each designation made by a racing association under §G(1) of this regulation; and
Each determination made by the racing association under §G(2) of this regulation.
The racing association may change one or more of its designations or determinations made under either §G(1) or (2) of this regulation.
A change under §G(4) of this regulation is not effective until:
There has been a mandatory distribution made under §S of this regulation; and
There is a publication of the change in the next program for live racing on which Quad Trifecta wagering is conducted.
Major Share Distributions. The major share of the net Quad Trifecta pool, plus any Quad Trifecta pool carryover, shall be distributed, as a single price pool, to those bettors who correctly select:
The first three finishers, in exact position, in each of the Quad Trifecta races; or
A lesser specified number of finishers, in exact position, in each of the Quad Trifecta races.
Principal Minor Share Distributions.

A principal minor share of the net Quad Trifecta pool, if designated, shall be distributed, as a single price pool, to those bettors who correctly select the greatest number of the first three finishers, in exact position, in each of the Quad Trifecta races, which is less than the number of correct selections qualifying for the major share of the net Quad Trifecta pool.

In designating the principal minor share, the racing association may declare a minimum number of correct selections that must be made in order for bettors to be eligible to receive the principal minor share.

Additional Minor Share Distributions. One or more additional minor shares of the net Quad Trifecta pool, if designated, shall be distributed, as a single price pool or pools, to those bettors who correctly select the designated number, or range, of the first three finishers, in exact position, in each of the Quad Trifecta races, which is less than the number of correct selections qualifying for the major share of the net Quad Trifecta pool.
Qualification for Additional Distributions.

Those bettors qualifying for a major share of the net Quad Trifecta pool also qualify for the principal minor share of the net Quad Trifecta pool and the additional minor shares of the net Quad Trifecta pool.

Those bettors qualifying for the principal minor share of the net Quad Trifecta pool also qualify for any additional minor shares of the net Quad Trifecta pool that require an equal or fewer number of winning selections as those selected by bettors qualifying for the principal minor share.
Those bettors qualifying for one or more minor shares of the net Quad Trifecta pool also qualify for any additional minor shares of the net Quad Trifecta pool that require fewer winning selections.
If any of the circumstances described in §K(1), (2), or (3) of this regulation occurs, the unbroken prices for each share shall be summed before rounding the prices for breakage.
Example.

To win the major share of the net Quad Trifecta pool, the bettor must correctly select the first three finishers, in exact position, in each of the Quad Trifecta races. To win the principal minor share, the bettor must correctly select the greatest number of the first three finishers, in exact position, in each of the Quad Trifecta races that is less than all 12. To win the one additional minor share, the bettor must correctly select at least nine or more of the first three finishers, in exact position, in each of the Quad Trifecta races.
$2 of wagers correctly selected all 12 positions. $2 of wagers correctly selected 11 positions. $3 of wagers correctly selected ten positions. $5 of wagers correctly selected nine positions.

Using a net Quad Trifecta pool of $132,001, and based on the racing association's designations under §G of this regulation, the major share of the net Quad Trifecta pool is $100,000, designated for correctly selecting all 12 of the first three finishers, in exact order, in each of the Quad Trifecta races. The principal minor share of the net Quad Trifecta pool, designated for correctly selecting the next greatest number of the first three finishers, in exact order, in each of the Quad Trifecta races, is $20,000.40. The one additional minor share of the net Quad Trifecta pool, designated for correctly selecting a range of nine or more of the first three finishers, in exact order, in each of the Quad Trifecta races, is $12,000.60.

The major share would be divided among those correctly selecting all 12 of the first three finishers, in exact order, in each of the Quad Trifecta races. The principal minor share would be divided among those correctly selecting 11 and 12 of the first three finishers, in exact order, in each of the Quad Trifecta races. The one additional minor share would be divided among all the wagers correctly selecting nine, ten, 11, and 12 of the first three finishers, in exact order, in each of the Quad Trifecta races.

The major share of $100,000 would be divided among the $2 of wagers correctly selecting all 12 of the first three finishers, in exact order, in each of the Quad Trifecta races, yielding an unbroken price of $50,000 per dollar wagered. The principal minor share of $20,000.40 would be divided among the $4 of wagers correctly selecting 11 or more of the first three finishers, in exact order, in each of the Quad Trifecta races, yielding an unbroken price of $5,000.10 per dollar wagered. The one additional minor share of $12,000.60 would be divided among the $12 of wagers correctly selecting nine or more of the first three finishers, in exact order, in each of the Quad Trifecta races, yielding an unbroken price of $1,000.05 per dollar wagered.

The sum of $50,000 + $5,000.10 + $1,000.05 = $56,000.15 is the combined unbroken price for correctly choosing all 12 of the first three finishers, in exact order, in each of the Quad Trifecta races. The sum of $5,000.10 + $1,000.05 = $6,000.15 is the combined unbroken price for correctly choosing 11 of the first three finishers, in exact order, in each of the Quad Trifecta races. $1,000.05 is the unbroken price for correctly selecting nine or ten of the first three finishers, in exact order, in each of the Quad Trifecta races.

If the rounding for breakage is to the next lower 10 cents, the final broken prices are $56,000.10 for the winners of the major share, $6,000.10 for the winners of the principal minor share, and $1,000 for the winners of the one additional minor share.
Except as provided in §§R and S of this regulation:

If there are no wagers qualifying for the major share, the major share of the net Quad Trifecta pool shall be carried over and added to the major share of the net Quad Trifecta pool on the next live racing program of the race meeting on which Quad Trifecta wagering is conducted; and
If there are no wagers qualifying for a designated minor share, including a designated principal minor share:

The minor share of the net Quad Trifecta pool shall be combined with the major share of the net Quad Trifecta pool for distribution as a single price pool to those who qualified for the major share; or

If no bettor qualifies for the major share of the net Quad Trifecta pool, the minor share of the net Quad Trifecta pool shall be carried over and added to the major share of the net Quad Trifecta pool on the next live racing program of the race meeting on which Quad Trifecta wagering is conducted.
Fields are prohibited in any of the four designated Quad Trifecta races.
Coupled Entries.
Coupled entries may be permitted in any of the four designated Quad Trifecta races.
Horses comprising a coupled entry shall be considered part of a single betting interest for the purposes of price calculations and distribution of the net Quad Trifecta pool.
If a horse in a coupled entry is officially withdrawn or scratched, the remaining horse, or horses, in the coupled entry shall remain as a valid betting interest.
If all horses in a coupled entry are scratched, the provisions of §Q of this regulation shall apply.
Coupled Entries Price Calculations.

For the purposes of price calculations only, coupled entries shall be calculated as a single finishing horse, using the finishing position of the leading horse in the coupled entry to determine the order of placing.
Example. If the actual order of finish in a race is 1 / 2 / 1A / 3 / 4, then the finishers used for that race in the Quad Trifecta would be 1 / 2 / 3 / 4.
Dead Heats. If a dead heat, or heats, occur in any of the races designated as the Quad Trifecta:
A horse in a dead heat shall be considered as finishing in the position for which it dead heated;
Any selection in a Quad Trifecta wager that correctly selects a horse in a dead heat as finishing in the position for which the horse dead heated shall be treated as a correct selection; and
Each designated share of the net Quad Trifecta pool that is distributed shall be distributed as a single price pool.
Wagering for the Quad Trifecta shall close at the same time that wagering is closed on the first designated race of the Quad Trifecta.
Scratches.
If an entire betting interest is scratched in a designated race of the Quad Trifecta while wagering on the Quad Trifecta is still open:
No more wagers selecting that betting interest may be accepted; and
Any bettor who previously placed a Quad Trifecta wager that includes one or more scratched betting interests may cancel their wager and receive a refund until Quad Trifecta betting is closed.
After Quad Trifecta wagering is closed:
Any betting interest that is scratched in its entirety shall be treated as an incorrect selection; and
Other correctly selected finishers in a Quad Trifecta wager shall continue to count toward a bettor's eligibility to win.

If, due to a late scratch, the number of betting interests in a race comprising the Quad Trifecta is reduced to fewer than three, the race shall be declared a "no contest", and the Quad Trifecta pool shall be subject to §R of this regulation.
Cancellations.

If any of the Quad Trifecta races are cancelled or declared "no contest" at any time before Quad Trifecta wagering is closed, all Quad Trifecta wagers made in connection with the given live racing program on which Quad Trifecta wagering was conducted shall be refunded.
If any of the Quad Trifecta races are cancelled or declared "no contest" after Quad Trifecta wagering is closed:
For purposes of determining the number of correct selections, each selection made in a Quad Trifecta race that is cancelled or declared "no contest" is deemed an incorrect selection;

If, after applying §R(2)(a) of this regulation, it remains possible for a bettor to correctly select the number of the first three finishers, in exact order, to qualify for the major share of the net Quad Trifecta pool as designated by the racing association under §H of this regulation, the Net Quad Trifecta pool, plus the Quad Trifecta pool carryover, shall be distributed according to §§H, I, and J of this regulation; and

If, after applying §R(2)(a) of this regulation, it becomes impossible for a bettor to correctly select the number of the first three finishers, in exact order, to qualify for the major share of the net Quad Trifecta pool as designated by the racing association under §H of this regulation:

The major share plus the principal minor share of the net Quad Trifecta pool, but not the Quad Trifecta pool carryover, shall be distributed to those who correctly select the greatest number of the first three finishers in their exact positions in each of the remaining Quad Trifecta races; and
Winners of a designated additional minor share shall receive the percentage of the net Quad Trifecta pool that is designated for that minor share according to §G of this regulation.
If the net Quad Trifecta pool has been designated for distribution in accordance with §S of this regulation, the provisions of §S of this regulation shall apply.
Mandatory Distribution.
The Quad Trifecta pool carryover may be designated for distribution on a specified date:
If it is the closing day of the race meet;
If the association declares its intention to do so at least 24 hours before the opening of Quad Trifecta wagering for which there is to be a mandatory distribution; or
Upon such other condition the Commission may approve.

If the Quad Trifecta pool carryover is designated for a mandatory distribution on a specified date and, on that date, there are no wagers qualifying for the major share, then the following precedence shall be followed in determining winning wagers for the net Quad Trifecta pool and the Quad Trifecta pool carryover:

The major share of the net Quad Trifecta pool, the principal minor share of the net Quad Trifecta pool, and the Quad Trifecta pool carryover shall be distributed to those who correctly selected the most finishers, in their exact positions, in the Quad Trifecta races with designated additional minor pools also being awarded; and

If there are no wagers which select even one finisher, in its exact position, in the Quad Trifecta races, then all Quad Trifecta wagers shall become winners and share 100 percent of that day's net Quad Trifecta pool and the Quad Trifecta pool carryover.
If, for any reason, there is not a mandatory distribution as provided in this section, the Quad Trifecta pool carryover shall be:
Deposited in an interest bearing account at a bank located in the State which is approved by the Commission; and
With accrued interest, added to the net Quad Trifecta pool of the next race meet held by the racing association.
Upon Commission approval, a racing association may offer a guaranteed pay-out on Quad Trifecta wagering by:
Announcing the amount of the guaranteed pay-out at least 24 hours before the opening of Quad Trifecta wagering for which there is to be a guaranteed pay-out; and
Adding monies to the current Quad Trifecta pool carryover in an amount sufficient to satisfy the guaranteed pay-out.
The added monies under §T(2) of this regulation are not subject to take-out.
The purchase and acceptance of a Quad Trifecta wager by a bettor shall constitute:
An acknowledgment of the correctness of the ticket; and
An agreement to be bound by the terms and provisions of this regulation.
The sale of a Quad Trifecta wager other than from a pari-mutuel wagering machine, and the resale of a Quad Trifecta ticket from one person to another, is prohibited.
Neither a racing association, nor a totalisator company, nor the Commission, nor the State shall be liable to any person for a Quad Trifecta ticket which is not:
A winning wager in accordance with the provisions of this regulation; or
Delivered, for any reason, including:
A mechanical malfunction;
An electrical failure; or
A machine locking.
This regulation shall be displayed prominently in the betting area of the racing association conducting Quad Trifecta wagering.

The Super High Five is a contract by the purchaser of a ticket combining five horses to finish first, second, third, fourth, and fifth, in that specific order, in a race on which Super High Five wagering is offered. Payment of the ticket shall be made only to the purchaser who has selected the same order of finish as officially posted.
The Super High Five is not a parlay and has no connection with, or relation to, any other wagering pool. The Super High Five shall be calculated as an entirely separate pool.
Super High Five tickets shall be sold in $1 denominations or greater.
Super High Five wagering may be conducted on a race that has at least seven separate wagering interests.
If there is no pari-mutuel ticket issued that selects the first five finishers in exact order, then the entire net pool shall be:
Carried over to the next qualifying race offering Super High Five wagering; and
Combined with the Super High Five net pool for that race to determine the applicable payout.
Distribution.
The entire Super High Five net pool plus any carryover shall be distributed on the last day of the race meet by the racing association, which shall hold Super High Five wagering on one race that day.

If a ticket is not sold that correctly selects five horses to finish first, second, third, fourth, and fifth, in that specific order, the entire net pool plus any carryover shall be distributed to the holders of tickets that correctly select four horses to finish first, second, third, and fourth, in that specific order.

If such a ticket is not sold, the entire net pool plus any carryover shall be distributed to the holders of tickets that correctly select three horses to finish first, second, and third, in that specific order.

If such a ticket is not sold, the entire net pool plus any carryover shall be distributed to the holders of tickets that correctly select two horses to finish first and second, in that specific order.
If no such ticket is sold, the entire net pool plus any carryover shall be distributed to the holders of tickets that correctly select the winner of the race.
If no such ticket is sold, the entire net pool plus any carryover shall be evenly distributed to the holders of all tickets.
If, for any reason, there is not a mandatory distribution of the Super High Five carryover as provided in §F of this regulation, the Super High Five carryover shall be:
Placed into an interest bearing account as approved by the Commission; and

With accrued interest, added to the Super High Five pool of the next race meet held by a racing association where Super High Five wagering is conducted, unless otherwise agreed by that racing association and the racing association where the Super High Five pool carryover was generated.
If a dead heat, or heats, occur in a race on which there is Super High Five wagering:
A horse in a dead heat shall be considered as finishing in the position for which it dead heated; and
Any selection in a Super High Five wager that correctly selects a horse in a dead heat as finishing in the position for which the horse dead heated shall be treated as a correct selection.
In the event of a scratch in a Super High Five race:
Exchanges may not be made; and
All tickets that include the scratched horse shall be refunded.
Coupled entries are permitted, but fields are prohibited in Super High Five races.

For price calculations only, coupled entries shall be calculated as a single finishing horse, using the finishing position of the leading horse in the coupled entry to determine the order of placing. Example: If the actual order of finish in a race is 1 / 2 / 1A / 3 / 4, 5, then the finishers used for that race in the Super High Five would be 1 / 2 / 3 / 4 / 5.
Sale.
Super High Five tickets shall be sold only by the licensee through pari-mutuel machines programmed to print all selections on one ticket.
Resale of tickets from one individual to another is prohibited and is grounds for ejection.
This regulation shall be printed in heavy type in a conspicuous place in the program or prominently posted near the betting windows of any association conducting this type of wager.
A jockey challenge event is one in which the Racing Association:
Designates the specific races on a racing program that will comprise the event;
Designates those jockeys who are scheduled to ride in each of the races comprising the event; and
Assigns a number to each of the jockeys participating in these races.
The number of horses scheduled to participate in each race comprising the event shall be the same or greater than the number of jockeys selected by the Association to participate in the event.
A racing association conducting a jockey challenge event may offer win and exacta wagering on the event.
Points.
Points shall be awarded to each betting interest according to the finish of the horses in each race comprising the jockey challenge event as follows:
12 points for a first place finisher;
6 points for a second place finisher;
4 points for a third place finisher; and
3 points for a fourth place finisher.

If there is a dead heat for any position in one or more of the races comprising this event, the points for the position dead-heated and subsequent position or positions, as appropriate, shall be aggregated and then allocated proportionately for the horses involved in the dead heat.

If a horse is scratched or declared a nonstarter in the race and the selected jockey is not reassigned amount, the actual favorite, as evidenced by the amounts wagered in the win pool at the time of the start of that race will be substituted for the non-starting selection.

If the rider is reassigned a mount due to a scratch, any points earned in accordance with the scale described in §D(1) of this Regulation by the re-assigned mount shall be credited to the jockey's point score.

If a jockey fails to a ride a horse to which the jockey has been assigned for any reason other than a scratch or that horse being declared a "non-starter," and the jockey is not reassigned to another mount in that same race, points shall be awarded based upon the finish of the horse to which the jockey originally was assigned.
Cancellation of Races—"No Race".
If a race in the jockey challenge event is cancelled or declared "No Race", the winners shall be determined by the points awarded in the remaining races comprising the jockey challenge event.
If two or more of the races comprising the jockey challenge event are cancelled or declared "No Race", the entire jockey challenge event pool shall be refunded.
After the last race of the jockey challenge event, the points earned by each of the participating jockeys shall be totaled and the betting interest with the:
Highest number of points shall be considered to have finished first; and
Second highest number of points shall be considered to have finished second.
Ties.
Any ties for the places determined under §F of this regulation shall be considered dead heats.
Payout prices for ties determined under §F of this regulation shall be calculated as prescribed in Regulation .70G of this chapter.

The Pick (n) Jackpot is a type of bet encompassing five or more races, the exact number of races being determined by the number substituted for (n), where, unless otherwise provided, only one, unique ticket holder designates the official winners in each of the Pick (n) Jackpot races.

Except as provided in §G of this regulation, the net pari-mutuel pool for the Pick (n) Jackpot bet that day, together with any carryover from previous pools of the same type of bet, shall be distributed to the holder of the one, unique pari-mutuel ticket which correctly designates the official winners in each of the Pick (n) Jackpot races for that day.

In the event there is more than one pari-mutuel ticket which correctly designates the official winners in each of the Pick (n) Jackpot races for that day, the net pari-mutuel pool for the Pick (n) Jackpot bets that day shall be distributed:
60 percent, equally, to the holders of pari-mutuel tickets which correctly designate the official winners in each of the Pick (n) Jackpot races for that day; and
40 percent to the Pick (n) Jackpot carryover pool.

In the event there is no pari-mutuel ticket which correctly designates the official winners in each of the Pick (n) Jackpot races for that day, the net pari-mutuel pool for the Pick (n) Jackpot bets that day shall be distributed:
60 percent, equally, to the holders of pari-mutuel tickets which correctly designate the most official winners in each of the Pick (n) Jackpot races for that day; and
40 percent to the Pick (n) Jackpot carryover pool.
If one or more of the races scheduled as part of the Pick (n) Jackpot bet, but less than 50 percent of the races scheduled as part of this bet, are cancelled or declared a "no contest":

The net pari-mutuel pool for the Pick (n) Jackpot bets that day shall be distributed, equally, to the holders of pari-mutuel tickets which correctly designate the most official winners in the races that were run; and
There shall be no carryover from that net pool.
A Pick (n) Jackpot bet shall be refunded if:
For any reason, 50 percent or more of the races scheduled as a part of this bet are cancelled or declared a "no contest"; or
No bet selects any winner in the Pick (n) Jackpot races.
Mandatory Distribution.
The Pick (n) Jackpot carryover pool may be designated for mandatory distribution on a specified date:
If it is the closing day of the race meet;
If the association declares its intention to do so at least 72 hours before the opening of Pick (n) Jackpot wagering for which there is to be a mandatory distribution; or
Upon such other condition the Commission may approve.

If the Pick (n) Jackpot carryover pool is designated for a mandatory distribution on a specified date and, on that date, there is no unique winning ticket holder under §B of this regulation, then the following precedence shall be followed in determining winning wagers for the mandatory distribution of both the net Pick (n) Jackpot pool for that day and the Pick (n) Jackpot carryover pool:
Equally to holders of pari-mutuel tickets which correctly designate all of the official winners in each of the Pick (n) Jackpot races;

If there are no pari-mutuel tickets which correctly select all of the official winners in each of the Pick (n) Jackpot races, equally to the holders of pari-mutuel tickets which correctly designate the most official winners in each of the Pick (n) Jackpot races for that day; and

If there are no pari-mutuel tickets which correctly select even one winner in the Pick (n) Jackpot races for that day, then all Pick (n) Jackpot wagers shall become winners and share 100 percent of that day’s net Pick (n) Jackpot pool, together with the Pick (n) Jackpot carryover pool.
If, for any reason, there is not a mandatory distribution as provided in this section, the Pick (n) Jackpot carryover pool shall be:
Deposited in an interest bearing account at a bank located in the State this is approved by the Commission;
With accrued interest, added to the net Pick (n) Jackpot pool of the next race meet held by the racing association or an affiliated racing association; and
Distributed as a mandatory distribution on the next occasion Pick (n) Jackpot wagering is offered by the racing association or an affiliated racing association.

Races Moved from Turf to Main Track. If one or more of the races comprising the Pick (n) Jackpot is moved from the turf to the main track after the close of wagering for the Pick (n) Jackpot, each selection on a Pick (n) Jackpot ticket for that race shall be considered a winning selection.
If there is a dead heat for win in any of the Pick (n) Jackpot races, each horse in the dead heat shall be deemed to have won the race.
If a betting interest is scratched, excused, or determined by the judges to be a nonstarter:

The actual favorite, as evidenced by the amounts bet in the win pool when betting on the race in which the scratched betting interest was to participate is closed, shall be substituted for that betting interest;

If the amount bet in the win pool is identical on two or more favorites when betting on the race is closed, the favorite with the lowest program number shall be substituted for the scratched betting interest; or

Alternatively, the association may allow patrons the option of selecting an alternate wagering interest to be substituted for the scratched, excused or nonstarter wagering interest instead of the actual favorite as defined above, however, should that alternate selection also be scratched, the patron would then receive the actual favorite as defined above.
Coupled entries shall be permitted in races designated for Pick (n) Jackpot wagering.
The purchase and acceptance of a Pick (n) Jackpot wager by a bettor shall constitute:
An acknowledgment of the correctness of the ticket; and
An agreement to be bound by the terms and provisions of this regulation.
The sale of a Pick (n) Jackpot wager other than from a pari-mutuel wagering machine, and the re-sale of a Pick (n) Jackpot ticket from one person to another, is prohibited.
Neither a racing association, nor a totalizator company, nor the Commission, nor the State shall be liable to any person for a Pick (n) Jackpot ticket which is not:
A winning wager in accordance with the provisions of this regulation; or
Delivered, for any reason, including:
A mechanical malfunction;
An electrical failure; or
A machine locking.
This regulation shall be displayed prominently in the betting area of the racing association conducting Pick (n) Jackpot wagering.

The Roulette Wager shall be held as a separate pool in every race in which it is offered. It is a single-price pool that requires the selection of the designated group that includes the betting interest member that is the first-place finisher for a single contest.
For each race in which this wager is offered:
